str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A commander of a thousand men, a military tribune. From chilioi and archo; the commander of a thousand soldiers

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To lay hold of, take hold of, seize (sometimes with beneficent, sometimes with hostile, intent).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From ana and choreo; to retire.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To ask, inquire, ascertain by inquiry, understand.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
To report (from one place to another), bring a report, announce, declare. From apo and the base of aggelos; to announce.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
